body: Using a borrowed flashlight, Carol Barnes looked around what used to be her bedroom and dug up a soot-blackened blouse from a pile of plaster that used to be a wall. The interior walls, and almost everything else in her apartment in the Albany Houses in Brooklyn, are gone, blown away along with four other apartments in a gas explosion Friday
title: Amid the Rubble, a Sense of Relief

body: A powerful explosion, apparently caused by a ruptured gas line, blew out walls and collapsed much of the top floor of a housing project building in Brooklyn last night, leaving 14 people injured, one of them seriously, police and fire officials said. The top floor of the 14-story building at 205 Albany Avenue in Crown Heights had collapsed and
title: 14 Are Hurt In Explosion In Brooklyn

body: Two store employees and a robber were killed and another robber was critically wounded Saturday night in a shootout during an attempted holdup of a corner grocery store in Brooklyn, the police said. The killings were among 12 in the city from early Saturday to 5 P.M. yesterday, police records showed. The store workers, Mohamed Nagi, 27 years old,
title: Three Killed In a Holdup In Brooklyn

body: Beginning next month, the Brooklyn Museum will be closed on Mondays because of cutbacks in its operating budget. The museum, 200 Eastern Parkway, at Washington Avenue, in the Crown Heights section, is among 30 cultural institutions that have been affected by recent cuts in financing from New York City. It will be open Wednesdays through Sundays, 10
title: Brooklyn Museum Cutback

body: Christina Roberts, a senior at Park West High School in Manhattan, assumed she would feel out of place at an upstate college. "When you think upstate, you think white," Miss Roberts said. That was before she visited the State University of New York's College of Arts and Sciences at Brockport, almost 400 miles away in western New York. As a guest of
title: SUNY Seeks More Minority Students

body: A 24-year-old Brooklyn man was charged last night in the slaying of a retired New York City police officer who was shot to death when he tried to stop two armed men from robbing passengers on a subway train in lower Manhattan in October, the police said. The suspect, Shaborn Esquilin of 1545 St. John's Place, in the Crown Heights section, was
title: Brooklyn Man Is Held In Ex-Officer's Slaying

body: A 16-year-old Brooklyn youth was shot to death in front of a public school yesterday as he walked away from a man who repeatedly asked him, "Remember me?" the police said. The youth, Reginald McLucas, was shot once in the back at 10:30 A.M. in front of 532 Albany Avenue in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn, said Detective Joseph McConville, a
title: Brooklyn Youth Killed in Front of a School

body: Seventeen people have been arrested in raids against what Federal agents called a ruthless Jamaican drug-trafficking gang that controlled crack houses in Brooklyn and Dallas and has been linked to at least 10 killings. But the leader of the organization and several of his top lieutenants evaded the Thursday night dragnet by Federal agents and New
title: U.S. Agents Seize 17 In Raids to Dismantle Jamaican Drug Ring

body: A Brooklyn foster mother and her boyfriend were indicted last night in the rape and sexual abuse of four young sisters who had been placed in the woman's care by city welfare officials. The indictments came two days after the Brooklyn District Attorney's office filed criminal complaints that detail a five-year pattern of abuse in the home of the
title: Couple Indicted in Abuse Of 4 Sisters in Brooklyn

body: A Brooklyn man who is charged with sexually abusing four young sisters adopted by his girlfriend signed two of them out of school at least 22 times this year to have sex with them, the police said yesterday. The girls, who are 6, 9, 12 and 16 years old, were placed by city welfare officials in 1983 in the care of Carol Webb, 42, of 446 Kingston
title: Police Say Abuse Suspect Took Girls Out of School to Have Sex

body: Nine people were slain in New York City in a 12-hour period Monday night and Tuesday morning, as the city continued to race toward a record number of homicides this year, the police said. The crimes ranged from drive-by shootings by drug dealers to cold-blooded executions on lonely roads. In one case, the police said, an uncle was stabbed to death
title: Killing Continues at Record Pace; 9 Slain in 12 Hours in New York

body: A Brooklyn woman and her boyfriend were charged yesterday with sexually abusing four sisters placed in her care by city child welfare officials, the police said. The police said the girls, who are 6, 9, 12 and 16 years old, were placed in the foster care of Carol Webb, 42, of 446 Kingston Avenue in the Crown Heights section, six years ago. Ms. Webb
title: Brooklyn Woman and Boyfriend Charged in Sex Abuse of 4 Sisters

body: Unlike many of his predecessors, the new Brooklyn Democratic leader, Assemblyman Clarence Norman Jr., doesn't like to be called "boss." He prefers "coordinator slash mediator." Mr. Norman, the first black and at 39 years old, very likely the youngest leader of the most influential Democratic organization in the state, will need all the mediating
title: In Brooklyn, Party Leader Sees New Era

body: A Brooklyn man has been convicted of attempted manslaughter in the shooting of a police officer who was helping social workers remove the man's children from his home. title: Brooklyn Man Guilty in Shooting of Officer

body: On the corner of Utica and Sterling in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn, in the light of a bright fall afternoon, Trent D. met a man who helped him through a neighborhood rite. title: Guns Offer New York Teen-Agers A Commonplace, Deadly Allure

body: LEAD: Donald Taylor is a basketball player for Prospect Heights High School in Brooklyn who prays daily to thank God for what he has. It is evident that he does not have much.
